p: In our study, a series of available coronavirus inhibitors were applied in FRET-based assays to identify an effective inhibitor of PEDV. GC376, a dipeptidyl bisulfite adduct salt, worked best and was selected as the subject of subsequent experiments. Biochemical assays yielded an IC 50 of 1.11 ± 0.13 μM for GC376 against the PEDV 3CL pro, which was slightly higher than that against the transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV) 3CL pro (0.82 ± 0.47 μM) and lower than that against the SARS-CoV 3CL pro (4.35 ± 0.47 μM) [ 35].
